messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Any unschoolers organic farming near San Luis Obispo, CA?
messages.msgSnippet: I suggest you post on the state and local lists. The HomeSchool Association of California (HSC) list has people from your area - they might be able to help you
messages.messageBody:
I suggest you post on the state and local lists. The HomeSchool
Association of California (HSC) list has people from your area - they
might be able to help you make connections. Ask there about local
lists, too.

To subscribe, send a blank email to <ca-Homeschooling-HSC-subscribe@yahoogroups.com
>.

-pam


On Jan 15, 2009, at 7:55 AM, holistic_living wrote:

> We have rented some acreage near SLO and my son wants to raise some
> pigs, chickens and maybe milk goats, maybe a cow or two. I would also
> like to do some organic gardening but we need some basic mentoring. I
> would be willing to trade for some free labor, housecleaning,
> whatever.
> I would like to raise the animals as naturally and compassionately as
> possible. Is there anyone locally doing this that could mentor us a
> little? We are actually in Arroyo Grande which is a little south of
> SLO.

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Any unschoolers organic farming near San Luis Obispo, CA?
messages.msgSnippet: There are lots of farms in that area. Plus lots of great blogs about it. Follow a fellow unschooling mom blog on homesteading:
messages.messageBody:
There are lots of farms in that area. Plus lots of great blogs about it.
Follow a fellow unschooling mom blog on homesteading:

http://touchtheearthfarm.blogspot.com/

She has many links to other unshooling homesteaders.
 
Alex Polikowsky
http://polykow.blogspot.com/

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Any unschoolers organic farming near San Luis Obispo, CA?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi hon, I do not post often, but have gleaned tons of information from this group. I am on the opposite coast but I have run a certified naturally grown market
messages.messageBody:
Hi hon,

I do not post often, but have gleaned tons of information from this group. I am on the opposite coast but I have run a certified naturally grown market garden, free range laying hens, goats, etc. I would be happy to share any information with you. :) Go ahead and email me off list.



Tammy Curry





________________________________
From: holistic_living <holistic_living@...>
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, January 15, 2009 10:55:11 AM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Any unschoolers organic farming near San Luis Obispo, CA?


We have rented some acreage near SLO and my son wants to raise some
pigs, chickens and maybe milk goats, maybe a cow or two. I would also
like to do some organic gardening but we need some basic mentoring. I
would be willing to trade for some free labor, housecleaning, whatever.
I would like to raise the animals as naturally and compassionately as
possible. Is there anyone locally doing this that could mentor us a
little? We are actually in Arroyo Grande which is a little south of SLO.






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Any unschoolers organic farming near San Luis Obispo, CA?
messages.msgSnippet: We have rented some acreage near SLO and my son wants to raise some pigs, chickens and maybe milk goats, maybe a cow or two. I would also like to do some
messages.messageBody:
We have rented some acreage near SLO and my son wants to raise some
pigs, chickens and maybe milk goats, maybe a cow or two. I would also
like to do some organic gardening but we need some basic mentoring. I
would be willing to trade for some free labor, housecleaning, whatever.
I would like to raise the animals as naturally and compassionately as
possible. Is there anyone locally doing this that could mentor us a
little? We are actually in Arroyo Grande which is a little south of SLO.
